posts.title: Newark mayor arrested by ICE agents at detention center
top_comments:
"Witnesses said the arrest came after Baraka attempted to join a scheduled tour of the facility with three members of New Jersey’s congressional delegation, Reps. Robert Menendez, LaMonica McIver, and Bonnie Watson Coleman.

When federal officials blocked his entry, a heated argument broke out, according to Viri Martinez, an activist with the New Jersey Alliance for Immigrant Justice. It continued even after Baraka returned to the public side of the gates.

. . . 

In video of the altercation shared with The Associated Press, a federal official in a jacket with the logo of the Homeland Security Investigations can be heard telling Baraka he could not join a tour of the facility because “you are not a congress member.”

Baraka then left the secure area, rejoining protesters on the public side of the gate. Video showed him speaking through the gate to a man in a suit, who informed him: “They’re talking about coming back to arrest you.”

“I’m not on their property, they can’t come out on the street and arrest me,” Baraka replied.

Minutes later several ICE agents, some wearing face coverings, surrounded Baraka and others on the public side of the gate. As protesters cried out, “Shame,” Baraka was dragged back through the security gate in handcuffs."
Wow surprising, they are all masked.

Alina Habba is a fucking US ATTORNEY?

I guess I shouldn’t be surprised…
What a fucking joke

Democrats need to aggressively oppose this gestapo shit AND offer a lawful and humane immigration solution
Something’s going to give in this country. All this is already happening and Trump has only been in power 100 days and some change. Can’t even imagine how much worse things are going to get.
What I don't understand is how ICE was able to arrest him. If this is criminal trespass, and it is committed by a citizen, then local police had jurisdiction.
Gestapo doin Gestapo shit.

It is not mistake. It is blatant racism. 

"An ICE attorney in Dallas, James “Jim” Joseph Rodden, is under scrutiny following allegations that he operated a white supremacist account on X (formerly Twitter) under the handle u/GlomarResponder".

[https://www.texasobserver.org/ice-prosecutor-dallas-white-supremacist-x-account/](https://www.texasobserver.org/ice-prosecutor-dallas-white-supremacist-x-account/)
ICE is a rogue paramilitary unit. Fuck ICE
Arresting judges and elected officials. Don't overreact. Totally normal....in places like Nazi Germany.
This administration is disgusting

So let me get this straight, when it's POC looking for asylum in America its bad. But when it's white people, its good? And not to mention all the free shit their getting as well? Hypocrisy of the highest order.

posts.title: India says it is committed to non-escalation if Pakistan reciprocates
top_comments:
ITT: Nationalist beefing 

I know it's not high traffic hours for Europe and morning for Americans when this was posted, so I understand why.

I just think it's funny that everyone's posting known nationalist news sources to prove one side is "wrong", like this hasn't been escalated by both parties.

recap:  
🗓 **April 2**2 – A terrorist attack in Pahalgam kills 26 civilians; TRF claims responsibility, prompting Indian outrage and allegations against Pakistan.  
🗓 **April 23–2**5 – India suspends the Indus Waters Treaty, expels Pakistani diplomats, and shuts down the Wagah-Attari border.  
🗓 **May 7 (Morning**) – India launches **Operation Sindoo**r, striking 9 terrorist targets in Pakistan-administered areas with UAVs and Rafale jets.  
🗓 **May 7 (Evening**) – Pakistan retaliates with artillery attacks on Poonch, Rajouri, and Uri sectors, killing 15 and injuring 40  
🗓 **May 7–**8 – Pakistani drones and missiles hit 15 Indian military sites; India activates S-400 systems and intercepts most threats.  
🗓 **May 8 (Night**) – India retaliates using Heron and Tapas drones, destroying Pakistani artillery sites and one radar.  
🗓 **May 8–9 (Overnight**) – Pakistan violates Indian airspace with 300–400 drones across 36 locations; India intercepts many and strikes 4 Pakistani air defense sites.  
🗓 **May 9 (Early Morning**) – A Pakistani UAV and commando raid near Jammu fails; multiple intruders are neutralized.  
🗓 **May 9 (Night**) – Pakistan launches a widespread drone and missile assault on 26 Indian locations including Baramulla, Jammu, Pathankot, and Ferozpur.  
🗓 **May 10 (Morning**) – Pakistan officially announces **Operation Bunyan ul Marsoo**s, launches further drones and a Fatah-II missile (intercepted near Sirsa).

Pak calls meeting of Nuclear team
so India launches missiles into Pakistan and is now committed to non-escalation?

Lol at India.  Firstly, they accuse Pakistan of their involvement in the attack without any neutral inquiry into the issue. Followed up with a few diplomatic manoeuvres, e.g., IWT. Then, they carried out military actions and ended up losing at least 2 aircraft's. And now, when Pakistan starts retaliating with its operation, India comes out with the realisation that it's time to stop escalating the issue. 


It could have solved this. All of this, with just direct communication from the very start. Unnecessary loss of lives.


Edit: Downvotes do not mean it is false. Hope you Indians open up to the reality of your war-mongering government a.k.a Modi.
When your best air defense s400 get destroyed, you want to de escalate 😂

This is not only about the religiously motivated Pahalgam attack, the culprits of the 26/11 attack, the indian parliament attack, all are hiding in Pakistan ( they're even living a good life, lol ), what Pakistan does about those, absolutely nothing, you can believe a " blacklisted terrorist" country

posts.title: Radar screens at Newark airport went black again overnight
top_comments: at this point, I'm waiting to wake up to the headline of a massive tragedy happening at the airport. seems like things are getting dire if there is pressure getting pushed to get this fixed; as it should be. I hope someone get's their head out of their ass and gets this prioritized a week ago.
Statistics say its probably ok, but I still just changed my upcoming flight so I don't have to connect through Newark.

> Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said he hopes to have the system built in the next three to four years.
  
That's the timeframe for fixing this problem?

Huh, I remember the last president wanting to spend billions on reinvesting on FAA infrastructure. It even got bipartisan support... Odd they can't just use the money that is already promised to help with this

The Daily had a good episode on this a few days ago. Boils down to latency and lack of backup when their systems do go down and how easy it is for someone to just unplug these systems with no oversight. These systems are also old and need to be upgraded. Newark ATC employees were based in Long Island but FAA moved them to Philadelphia but kept the transmissions still going through Long Island and relaying to Philadelphia
I'm flying out of Newark twice in the next two weeks. Can't wait to roll the dice with my life lol.
Just a preview of the problems we can expect when you take a wrecking ball to government with minimal to no planning. Who cares about infrastructure when you can have tax cuts.
Republicans have blocked funding for this for 20 years.

Time to blame the previous administration for requesting **more** staff and modernization updates to prevent this happening.  Clearly that's the issue, not firing air traffic controllers and staff that keeps things running.

Natural result of deferring upkeep of infrastructure maintenance in the chase of budget cuts.  Expect more of this as long as the conservative/libertarian ideology is making decisions.

Fifty years of the destructive meme that government needs to get out of the way of free enterprise.  You trust that your planes will fly, food & drugs will be safe, etc because of the regulatory state.

posts.title: Holocaust survivor Margot Friedländer dies at 103
top_comments:
“There is no Christian blood, there is no Muslim blood, there is no Jewish blood, there is only human blood.”

 - Margot Friedlander
May her memory be a blessing.

"Friedländer died in Berlin, the same day she was expected to receive the German Order of Merit".

wild.
Another voice is silent. Let's not forget what she had to say.
'Everybody knew about it, and they looked away'
May she rest in peace

I often think about being a German in Germany during the Nazi regime. I would love to think that I would not look the other way and I would protect my Jewish friends and neighbors and then I think about losing my family as a result. It’s really hard to place blame on people who did what it took to survive. RIP, Margot.
May her memory be a blessing.
May she rest peacefully. She survived a horrific time that is emerging once again.
I’m sorry she didn’t live to see trump thrown out of office. I hope the rest of us do very soon.  She was an important voice in these dark times.

posts.title: A failed Soviet-era spacecraft that aimed for Venus is expected to crash back to Earth tonight
top_comments: Shoot for Venus. If you miss you’ll land among the, um, Earth.
I hope it doesn’t crash through my roof!

*Article Excerpt from Jackie Wattles (CNN):*

A Soviet-era spacecraft that was designed to make a soft landing on Venus — but instead remained trapped in Earth orbit for decades — is slated to fall from the sky Friday night or early Saturday, according to the latest estimates from experts.

The object, referred to as Cosmos 482 or Kosmos 482, is believed to be a capsule launched by the Soviet Union in March 1972 that failed en route to a transfer orbit that would have taken it to Venus to study its environment.

In the decades since, the object has circled Earth aimlessly as it was slowly dragged back toward home.

Astronomers and space traffic experts have had their eyes on the object for years now as its orbital path has slowly reached lower and lower altitudes, a result of the subtle atmospheric drag that exists even hundreds of miles away from Earth.

The cylinder-shaped craft, which is about 3 feet (1 meter) in diameter, is now predicted to crash back to Earth overnight. Cosmos 482 is on track to hit the ground or ocean roughly between 10 p.m. and 6:30 a.m. ET, according to four analyses of the object from various institutions, including the European Space Agency and the federally funded US research group Aerospace Corporation.

That guidance is still in line with predictions issued by space traffic experts earlier this week. The estimated time frame of the vehicle’s final descent will narrow as the event approaches.

Because of the sheer complexity of spaceflight and unpredictable factors, such as space weather, it can be extremely difficult to pinpoint exactly when or where an object will fall out of orbit.

This particular piece of space junk likely won’t pose a risk to people on the ground.

“This object was designed to survive reentering Venus, so there’s fair odds that it’ll survive coming back (to Earth) in one piece,” said Marlon Sorge, a space debris expert with The Aerospace Corporation, on Monday. “That actually makes the risk less … because it would stay intact.”

from the article:
“What to do if you spot debris:

While a landing on dry ground is unlikely, it’s not impossible. The Cosmos 482 object’s trajectory shows it could hit anywhere within a broad swath of land that includes “the whole of Africa, South America, Australia, the USA, parts of Canada, parts of Europe, and parts of Asia,” said Marco Langbroek, a lecturer and space traffic expert at Delft Technical University in the Netherlands, via email.

Sorge emphasized that if Cosmos 482 hits the ground after its final descent tonight, onlookers are advised to keep their distance. The aged spacecraft could leak dangerous fuels or pose other risks to people and property.
“Contact the authorities,” Sorge urged. “Please don’t mess with it.”
Isn't this what caused the zombie outbreak in the original "Night of the Living Dead?"

So in summary a 3 foot long piece of invincible space debris traveling at terminal velocity will land somewhere in “the whole of Africa, South America, Australia, the USA, parts of Canada, parts of Europe, and parts of Asia” or the ocean. Cool, cool. That is completely unconcerning except for the random ball of death that could kill anyone or no one sometime in the next day or so.

>This particular piece of space junk likely won’t pose a risk to people on the ground

Like, rationally I get that the odds of it hitting anything of significance are low, but on the off chance that some poor bastard gets nailed by a 3-foot metal dildo going Mach fuck…
God it would be infinitely funny if it hit Putin.

I think I remember Taco Bell putting a target out in the Pacific one of these times. I believe if the satellite hit the target, everyone in the US would get a free taco. 


It didn't hit. The odds were astronomical.
I'm totally going to mess with it.

posts.title: Pakistan Army's spokesman claims India fired ballistic missiles that fell into Indian territory
top_comments: 6 airbases destroyed at Pakistan side and these clawns running fake news here
And another cycle of their lies and propaganda begins!
Pakistan claims uyghur muslims are treated well in China. They cant stand with their own, how can anyone trust whatever they say?
Already tired of this conflict and how people seem to think any side is justified.

***Way too many Westerners are sleeping on this one.***

The animosity here is both ***religious & national***.  It's a straight up holy war for both sides in addition to being a massive game of tug-of-war over issues like Kashmir that date back to the partitioning of India and frankly long before that.  Throw in the nuclear angle and you've got a debacle that could inflict damage on a scale not seen since WWII.  
  
  
....and the potential for China, US & Russia to get involved is not exactly lost here especially given China's proximity to both.

  
The only good news is there's far, far more to lose for both sides than there is to gain and the relative effectiveness of asymmetric warfare as being fought in Ukraine demonstrated that even a large scale mechanized invasion by either nation is going to be a fools errand in the long run with high fatalities  and few defenses against small short-distance drones
[deleted]

Given enough time, it's inevitable that nuclear weapons are again used in warfare.   This of course would be a horrible event.  However, in a pragmatic sense, a silver lining would be that this horror would be like a dash of cold water to the face of other states considering their own use of nukes.  To be perfectly blunt, a few used in a conflict between second-tier powers is preferable to a MAD scenario between two superpowers.  

In other words, nuclear strikes between India and Pakistan could be an event that ends the world, or it could be an event that saves it.

posts.title: Biden created Chuckwalla monument in the California desert. A lawsuit aims to undo it
top_comments: I hope this stupid lawsuit is thrown out or better they lose the lawsuit. Wouldn't want a important piece of land being destroyed by greedy corporations and miners.

>A lawsuit filed in federal court is seeking to undo the 624,000-acre Chuckwalla National Monument in the Southern California desert, claiming President Biden overstepped his authority by setting aside such a vast swath of land days before leaving office.

>Plaintiffs represented by an Austin, Texas-based conservative think tank claim Biden abused the Antiquities Act, a 1906 law that allows presidents to create national monuments. The suit brought against the Interior Department highlights that the law mandates monuments be limited to the “smallest area compatible with proper care and management of the objects to be protected.”

>“If you look at the history, it was supposed to be limited to, let’s say, 100 acres, maybe 1,000 acres. But it certainly wasn’t the kind of expansion that we’ve seen in recent years,” said Matt Miller, senior attorney for the Texas Public Policy Foundation, which filed the suit.

>Supporters of Chuckwalla, which sits south of Joshua Tree National Park, point out that the law has long been used by presidents to protect large land masses — including the designation of the Grand Canyon by Theodore Roosevelt in 1908. On Jan. 14,[ Biden created Chuckwall](https://www.latimes.com/environment/story/2025-01-14/biden-creates-two-national-monuments-in-california-chuckwalla-sattitla-highlands)a to safeguard land sacred to tribes as well as important wildlife habitat and military sites.

>On May 1, the foundation [filed the suit](https://www.texaspolicy.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/Chuckwalla-Case-Complaint-Torongo-v.-Burgum.pdf) against the U.S. Department of the Interior in U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Michigan on behalf of a resident of the state with mining claims in the footprint of the monument and the BlueRibbon Coalition, a nonprofit that advocates for recreation access.

>According to the lawsuit, Daniel Torongo, whose family began mining in the region in 1978, and members of the BlueRibbon Coalition, will be prevented from using the land in ways they previously enjoyed because of the monument designation.

>Torongo, of Brighton, Mich., will face onerous restrictions to maintaining his claim and will not be able to expand it as he planned, potentially threatening his retirement plan to spend more time mining there with his family, according to the suit.

>“Although Mr. Torongo and his family have invested time and money in acquiring claims, equipment and relevant knowledge, the dream of expanding their operation beyond its current size is no longer possible,” the suit states.

>BlueRibbon Coalition members, meanwhile, which include off-roaders and dirt bikers, fear they’ll also face restrictions because of the “goal of maintaining the undeveloped character of the land,” according to the suit.

>The Interior Department hasn’t yet responded to the suit and spokeswoman J. Elizabeth Peace said department policy is not to comment on litigation.

Apparently the miners, off-roaders and dirtbikers feel the designation is infringing on their enjoyment of these beautiful lands, and they have people with deep pockets working to overturn it.
I hope they fucking cry more. “Messing with his retirement plans” go fuck yourself clownshoes asswipe.

Biden derangement syndrome?
Biden created prosperity out of a global pandemic and trump undid it, why not also a dumb monument?
Call out those by name in this ‘think tank’ shame them, protest at their homes and places of work.
The guy that mines in area can still mine, he’s just upset he can’t acquire more land to mine 🤦🏻‍♂️
anyone who identifies themselves as a conservative, i hope only negativity comes to you. nothing but sadness and pain.
Chuckwalla isn't even on the top 10 list of largest national monuments, with legal precedent going back over a century.

recap:  
🗓 **April 2**2 – A terrorist attack in Pahalgam kills 26 civilians; TRF claims responsibility, prompting Indian outrage and allegations against Pakistan.  
🗓 **April 23–2**5 – India suspends the Indus Waters Treaty, expels Pakistani diplomats, and shuts down the Wagah-Attari border.  
🗓 **May 7 (Morning**) – India launches **Operation Sindoo**r, striking 9 terrorist targets in Pakistan-administered areas with UAVs and Rafale jets.  
🗓 **May 7 (Evening**) – Pakistan retaliates with artillery attacks on Poonch, Rajouri, and Uri sectors, killing 15 and injuring 40  
🗓 **May 7–**8 – Pakistani drones and missiles hit 15 Indian military sites; India activates S-400 systems and intercepts most threats.  
🗓 **May 8 (Night**) – India retaliates using Heron and Tapas drones, destroying Pakistani artillery sites and one radar.  
🗓 **May 8–9 (Overnight**) – Pakistan violates Indian airspace with 300–400 drones across 36 locations; India intercepts many and strikes 4 Pakistani air defense sites.  
🗓 **May 9 (Early Morning**) – A Pakistani UAV and commando raid near Jammu fails; multiple intruders are neutralized.  
🗓 **May 9 (Night**) – Pakistan launches a widespread drone and missile assault on 26 Indian locations including Baramulla, Jammu, Pathankot, and Ferozpur.  
🗓 **May 10 (Morning**) – Pakistan officially announces **Operation Bunyan ul Marsoo**s, launches further drones and a Fatah-II missile (intercepted near Sirsa).

posts.title: A failed Soviet-era spacecraft that aimed for Venus is expected to crash back to Earth tonight
top_comments: Shoot for Venus. If you miss you’ll land among the, um, Earth.
I hope it doesn’t crash through my roof!

*Article Excerpt from Jackie Wattles (CNN):*

A Soviet-era spacecraft that was designed to make a soft landing on Venus — but instead remained trapped in Earth orbit for decades — is slated to fall from the sky Friday night or early Saturday, according to the latest estimates from experts.

The object, referred to as Cosmos 482 or Kosmos 482, is believed to be a capsule launched by the Soviet Union in March 1972 that failed en route to a transfer orbit that would have taken it to Venus to study its environment.

In the decades since, the object has circled Earth aimlessly as it was slowly dragged back toward home.

Astronomers and space traffic experts have had their eyes on the object for years now as its orbital path has slowly reached lower and lower altitudes, a result of the subtle atmospheric drag that exists even hundreds of miles away from Earth.

The cylinder-shaped craft, which is about 3 feet (1 meter) in diameter, is now predicted to crash back to Earth overnight. Cosmos 482 is on track to hit the ground or ocean roughly between 10 p.m. and 6:30 a.m. ET, according to four analyses of the object from various institutions, including the European Space Agency and the federally funded US research group Aerospace Corporation.

That guidance is still in line with predictions issued by space traffic experts earlier this week. The estimated time frame of the vehicle’s final descent will narrow as the event approaches.

Because of the sheer complexity of spaceflight and unpredictable factors, such as space weather, it can be extremely difficult to pinpoint exactly when or where an object will fall out of orbit.

This particular piece of space junk likely won’t pose a risk to people on the ground.

“This object was designed to survive reentering Venus, so there’s fair odds that it’ll survive coming back (to Earth) in one piece,” said Marlon Sorge, a space debris expert with The Aerospace Corporation, on Monday. “That actually makes the risk less … because it would stay intact.”

from the article:
“What to do if you spot debris:

While a landing on dry ground is unlikely, it’s not impossible. The Cosmos 482 object’s trajectory shows it could hit anywhere within a broad swath of land that includes “the whole of Africa, South America, Australia, the USA, parts of Canada, parts of Europe, and parts of Asia,” said Marco Langbroek, a lecturer and space traffic expert at Delft Technical University in the Netherlands, via email.

Sorge emphasized that if Cosmos 482 hits the ground after its final descent tonight, onlookers are advised to keep their distance. The aged spacecraft could leak dangerous fuels or pose other risks to people and property.
“Contact the authorities,” Sorge urged. “Please don’t mess with it.”
Isn't this what caused the zombie outbreak in the original "Night of the Living Dead?"

So in summary a 3 foot long piece of invincible space debris traveling at terminal velocity will land somewhere in “the whole of Africa, South America, Australia, the USA, parts of Canada, parts of Europe, and parts of Asia” or the ocean. Cool, cool. That is completely unconcerning except for the random ball of death that could kill anyone or no one sometime in the next day or so.

>This particular piece of space junk likely won’t pose a risk to people on the ground

Like, rationally I get that the odds of it hitting anything of significance are low, but on the off chance that some poor bastard gets nailed by a 3-foot metal dildo going Mach fuck…
God it would be infinitely funny if it hit Putin.

I think I remember Taco Bell putting a target out in the Pacific one of these times. I believe if the satellite hit the target, everyone in the US would get a free taco. 


It didn't hit. The odds were astronomical.
I'm totally going to mess with it.

posts.title: Newark mayor arrested by ICE agents at detention center
top_comments:
"Witnesses said the arrest came after Baraka attempted to join a scheduled tour of the facility with three members of New Jersey’s congressional delegation, Reps. Robert Menendez, LaMonica McIver, and Bonnie Watson Coleman.

When federal officials blocked his entry, a heated argument broke out, according to Viri Martinez, an activist with the New Jersey Alliance for Immigrant Justice. It continued even after Baraka returned to the public side of the gates.

. . . 

In video of the altercation shared with The Associated Press, a federal official in a jacket with the logo of the Homeland Security Investigations can be heard telling Baraka he could not join a tour of the facility because “you are not a congress member.”

Baraka then left the secure area, rejoining protesters on the public side of the gate. Video showed him speaking through the gate to a man in a suit, who informed him: “They’re talking about coming back to arrest you.”

“I’m not on their property, they can’t come out on the street and arrest me,” Baraka replied.

Minutes later several ICE agents, some wearing face coverings, surrounded Baraka and others on the public side of the gate. As protesters cried out, “Shame,” Baraka was dragged back through the security gate in handcuffs."
